page.title: 12Roads Around Notgrove
page.content: The main Cheltenham to Bourton-on-the- Water, A436, road runs across the Block, this being a fast straight road, well maintained, with a large lay-by for lorries and cars. In winter the road is regularly gritted and snow ploughed if needed by the Local Authority. The minor roads are as well maintained as funds allow. In winter the local Snow Plough Warden, one of the farm workers, keeps the village roads clear of snow. Fields ajoining the roads are bounded by the characteristic dry stone walls. The grass verges give rise to a host of common wild flowers, perhaps most impressive is the Cow Parsley, or Keck as it is locally known, in early summer and an abundance of white flowering May Blossom. At least a metre of the grass verge is always kept short to aid visibility.
